channel.title: Psi+ connection issue
channel.description:
Hello, I'll start with saying I'm well-aware of psi-plus poor privacy records and I'm also aware it's not recommended to use it. I'm in need of using xmpp+OTR client though, and I've been through all other possibilities (pidgin, gajim etc) and I'm trying to find one that works well, provides plugins for antispam (most important thing for me). I started fresh installation of whonix, everything is working well and smooth, but I'm having issue setting up Psi-plus. Installed it from repo (psi-plus). Didn't change anything, simply added xmpp accounts, but seems it can't connect. I tested different xmpp servers (they are up 100%) so I believe issue is with configuring the connection on psi-plus itself. Psi seems to be not connected at all, I can't even download list of available xmpp servers etc.
Right now I have everything on default, in options/application tab: Data transfer base port: 8010 Data transfer external address: empty Proxy settings: Default/None
in accounts tab: Connection proxy: none Compress traffic (if possible) - yes send 'keep alive' packets - yes enable stream management if possible - yes manually specify server host/port -no
I believe something has to be changed, because it's not connecting on fresh installation without changing any sort of default settings, but I have no idea what. I'll be thankful for any sort of advice.
Tried changing proxy settings to: socks5 127.0.0.1 9150 Still doesn't work.

fukkmylife:

Tried changing proxy settings to:
socks5
127.0.0.1
9150
Still doesn’t work.

Just a guess but you need to direct it at 10.152.152.10 where Tor is running and not localhost.

If you absolutely need a more modern OTR client go for a Debian Testing VM with CoyIM installed. It should use Tor by default.

For OMEMO the best thing we have is Gajim at the moment because Dino IM is broken and we don;t know why.

(There’s no plugin framework for Coy)
